summary: This is an email chain from May 2008 discussing investigative efforts related to Jeffrey Epstein. It covers attempts to locate and interview a potential witness in New York, service of subpoenas, and planning for meetings to finalize and present information. The tone suggests coordination among investigators or legal team members.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of his people not being interested in renegotiating, indicating he is a central figure in the matters being discussed.

persons.name: Lee
persons.context: Plans to meet on Sunday at the sender's house, indicating involvement in the coordination of activities.

connections.description: Lee is involved in planning meetings related to Epstein's case, suggesting a professional or investigative connection.

events.title: Planning meeting
events.description: A meeting is planned for Sunday, June 1st, to finalize everything so the sender can meet with IM on Monday and present on Tuesday.

events.title: Investigation update
events.description: Email discusses ongoing efforts to locate and interview a potential witness in New York, service of subpoenas, and negative results at a storage unit.

keyFacts: Investigators are attempting to locate and interview a potential witness in New York, but have been unable to connect her to the New York case despite matching age.
Subpoenas have been served, including one to Verizon which had to be redone, but they promised information for the week.
A search of a storage unit yielded negative results.
The parents and a family attorney of a potential witness have been contacted, but the witness does not want to speak with investigators.
Epstein's people are not interested in renegotiating, making 'rtsg' a non-starter.
